intro: Bahamia acuifera, commonly known as the Bahamian seagrass, is a marine flowering plant found in shallow coastal waters of the Bahamas. It belongs to the family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like blades that grow in dense underwater meadows. This plant plays a crucial role in stabilizing marine sediments and providing habitat for various aquatic species. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that are adapted for water dispersal. Bahamia acuifera is an important indicator of water quality and ecosystem health in its native environment.
